content.p: Match the small intestine section to the characteristic:

body.p: Shortest and least mobile, with input from stomach, liver and pancreas

response.feedback: Correct. Food enters through pyloric sphincter, while bile and pancreatic juice enters through hepatopancreatic sphincter.
Incorrect. This is the middle, mobile section with no accessory gland ducts.
Incorrect. This is the last, mobile section with no accessory gland ducts.

part.hint: This section receives food from the stomach through the pyloric sphincter.

body.p: Longest for increased transit time with continued digestion and absorption of most of the organic compounds

response.feedback: Inorrect. this is shortest of three sections.
Correct. In addition to length, the plicae circulares, villi, and microvilli also increase surface area for efficient absorption while chyme is in the small intestine.
Incorrect. While absorption of remaining nutrients does occur, much of that has typically already happened before chyme reaches this last section.

part.hint: This is the middle section, between the other two.

body.p: Location of specialized glands for secretion of bicarbonate-rich mucus

response.feedback: Correct. This secretion helps neutralize the acidic chyme entering from stomach.
Incorrect. The glands here secrete typical mucus for lubrication and protection.
Incorrect. The glands here secrete typical mucus for lubrication and protection.

part.hint: This would need to be in the section receiving the acidic material directly from the stomach.

body.p: Location of most Peyerâ€™s patches for immune response to bacteria that might enter from large intestine

response.feedback: Incorrect. This section receives the acidic chyme from stomach that helps destroy bacteria.
Incorrect. Although they are found here, this section is a distance from the large intestine.
Correct. This section connects to the large intestine at the ileocecal sphincter.

part.hint: This would need to be in the last section, connecting to the large intestine through the ileocecal sphincter.
